revised_title: Kinetic Study of Thermal Oxidation of Ethyl Linoleate
tldr: The authors investigated the kinetics of the thermal oxidation of ethyl linoleate, a simple olefinic ester, and found that oxidation chains are initiated by the thermal decomposition of ethyl linoleate hydroperoxide. The reaction mechanism involves propagation reactions and chain termination by mutual destruction of radical chain carriers. This study provides insights into the oxidation of olefins and has implications for the chemistry of rubber and related materials.
